utterance.speaker: ELLE DANIELS
utterance.content: Tessa, I’m home.

utterance.speaker: ELLE
utterance.content: Tess? Tess? You here?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, it’s you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Who did you think it was?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. I heard rustling.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: And you were going to fight them off with that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This could be very – What are you doing here? I thought you weren’t coming until next weekend.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I had to do laundry. I ran out of clothes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Already? It’s only been 2 weeks. Not that I’m not thrilled to see you, but don’t they have washing machines on campus?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: They’re not as nice.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And by nice you mean free.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Pretty much.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Uh, you’re going to need more orange juice, by the way.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh, and um … I finished the ice cream … too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And … how long have you been here?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Ten minutes?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. Well, as long as you are here, how about a Guitar Hero tournament? I have been writing all weekend. I could use a break.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh, actually I gotta go. I’m meeting some friends for a study session and I’m already late.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah… what about your laundry?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s okay. I’ll get it later. Bye Dad!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I mean she came home at least, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I just wish it was for more than laundry and supplies.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you get some writing done?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: With Mother gone? Are you kidding? Two chapters, but I gotta rewrite the crime scene. Right now it’s boring.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe this will inspire you, Castle. Pretty damn freaky. Name’s Tessa Horton, 29. Roommate came home from a weekend away and found her up there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh, geez. Who puts a body on a ceiling?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Beats me. But I probably won’t sleep for weeks.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Looks like something out of one of your books, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cause of death?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Ligature marks and petechia suggest strangulation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about this wound on her forehead?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s non-lethal. Given the detail, it looks like it was carved by some kind of razor.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s a symbol of some kind.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you recognize it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, but the killer went through a lot of trouble. It must mean something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s not easy hanging a body and she’s at least a hundred pounds.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: We checked in with CSU. They found prints in the hallway but the apartment is spotless. Looks like it’s been wiped down.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This guy cleaned up after himself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He didn’t mind taking his time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the killer knew that the roommate was going to be out of town. What’s the security like in this place?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Buzzer on the front door, no doorman or security cameras. But there’s no sign of forced entry. No sign of a struggle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She knew him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, canvass neighboring apartments for anyone that saw or heard anything. And I want to know what this symbol means.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, if Tessa knew our killer it’s possible that her roommate could shed some light on all of this.

utterance.speaker: ELLE
utterance.content: Every time I close my eyes I see her hanging there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What did she do for a living?

utterance.speaker: ELLE
utterance.content: She was an insurance broker for commercial real estate. Kurtzman Insurance.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Does she have a lot of friends?

utterance.speaker: ELLE
utterance.content: She was shy. And a workaholic. I practically had to drag her out of the house.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So no boyfriend then?

utterance.speaker: ELLE
utterance.content: Actually, she did start seeing someone. Maybe 6 weeks ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you know who?

utterance.speaker: ELLE
utterance.content: That’s the thing, she never did say. She – she acted like it was some big secret. Like maybe he was married or something? But he bought her jewelry. And took her to these fancy dinners. She said no one’s ever treated her that way before.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she tell you anything else about him? The way he looked? Where they met?

utterance.speaker: ELLE
utterance.content: No. All she said was he was every woman’s fairytale. Rich, handsome, and generous.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Some fairytale. I’ll tell you this much – there’s a lot more to this story than an affair with a married man.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe, but we won’t know what until we find him. Get on her phone records, see if you can ID this guy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. I’ll have them pull her emails, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Anything on that symbol yet?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I put a call in the Feds, they’re running it through their database right now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The way he left the body, the time it took? Whoever did this … he liked it.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: If she had a boyfriend nothing happened that night. There are no signs of sexual assault or activity. Death was by strangulation. Looks like a rope or a scarf.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Were you able to narrow down a time?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Somewhere between 2 and 3AM Saturday morning. Lividity and pooling indicate that the body was hung from the ceiling postmortem.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would he hang her body after he killed her?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ritual?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: That’s not all that’s weird. Strangulation is a violent act. But there were no signs that she fought back. No skin under the fingernails, no bruising. So I did some checking. She was drugged. Lung tissue suggests exposure to chloroform. Also your killer was careful. He was wearing gloves.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How can you tell?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Traces of talcum powder on the body. The same talc used in surgical gloves or the evidence gloves that you use at the crime scenes. Whoever this person is, they knew exactly what they were doing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s done this before.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ritualistic killing, takes pleasure in it, significant care taken at the crime scene –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All the hallmarks of a serial killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but I’ve never seen this MO.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, bad news. The Feds struck out on the symbol. It bears some similarities to some ancient alchemy signs but they’ve never seen this one before.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any luck on the phone records?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, but she spent a lot of time on the phone to a blocked number. Phone company traced it to an unlisted burner phone with an unlisted SIM.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So he planned ahead?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about her emails?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nothing from her mystery lover. So I had them take a look at her hard drive. Turns out portions of it have been surgically wiped. Like someone covering their tracks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So we’re back to square one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not necessarily. Uh, Tessa’s roommate said that he gave her some jewelry. Maybe he left a fingerprint on one of those pieces.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’ll head to her place, see what I can find out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jewelry. I never would have thought of that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I guess I’ll have to remind you when my birthday’s coming up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why Detective Beckett, was that a hint you just dropped?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why Mr. Castle, I do believe it was.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Shameless.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo Beckett. You got a second? I need a word.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We got the CSU report back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The inside of Tessa’s apartment was wiped clean.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, we expected that.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but we didn’t expect this. CSU were able to pull prints off the outside doorknob and from around the doorframe. And they found a set that didn’t match Tessa’s or her roommate’s. When they ran it they found a match to someone else in the system.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, who?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Richard Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah – uh – that can’t be right. You know what? It was – it was probably just an accident. He probably touched them on his way in before putting his gloves on.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, that would explain it. Except that CSU collected them before either of you arrived.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you sure about this?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Look for yourself, bro.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, think. Is it possible that you touched the doorknob or the frame on your way in?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was open when I came in, but I guess I must have.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Had you been in that building before?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not before today.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What about the victim? Are you sure you didn’t know her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Javi –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What? You know I have to ask.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, it’s simple, okay? He touched the door when he walked in. CSU must have got the timeframe wrong. That’s the only explanation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless I’ve got an evil twin.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Twins don’t have the same fingerprints. It’s a common misconception. This was you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I know. I was joking.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Contaminated crime scene is not a joke. I’ll square this away with CSU. You watch your hands next time, okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just be careful.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So, been through all of Tessa’s belongings. No sign of any high end jewelry. But from the empty spaces in her jewel box there might be some pieces missing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He took back the ones he gave her. It’s like he knew what we were looking for.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This guy really knows how to cover his tracks.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh no, not all of them. Canvass of the building turned up a neighbor who claims he saw someone heading to her apartment at 7:45 on Friday night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did the neighbor get a good look at him?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He got a clear shot right through his front door peephole. Bringing in a sketch artist right now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Get it over as soon as it’s done. The roommate might be able to ID him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER
utterance.content: Detective?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The roommate identified him Tessa’s boss, Lloyd Kurtzman, CEO of Kurtzman Insurance Brokerage.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any priors?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nothing major. He’s got a couple of harassment suits. But he does have a sealed juvie file.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A juvie file?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Call Judge Markaway. If Kurtzman was torturing puppies as a kid, I want to know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Good looking and rich, huh? Just like Tessa’s mystery man.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And like Tessa’s mystery man – he’s married.

utterance.speaker: LLOYD KURTZMAN
utterance.content: She was such a glowing presence. You couldn’t help but notice her. It’s hard to imagine anyone wanting to kill her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sure it is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Were the two of you close?

utterance.speaker: KURTZMAN
utterance.content: As close as I am to any of my employees.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And when was the last time that you saw her?

utterance.speaker: KURTZMAN
utterance.content: Friday morning. At our staff meeting.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Friday morning? Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: KURTZMAN
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not Friday evening?

utterance.speaker: KURTZMAN
utterance.content: No –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you didn’t go to Tessa’s apartment at 7:45?

utterance.speaker: KURTZMAN
utterance.content: Her apartment? No, no.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s funny. We um – we have a witness that saw you there that night. Mr. Kurtzman, where were you Friday night?

utterance.speaker: KURTZMAN
utterance.content: I – um – I’d like to speak with my lawyer now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s not talking.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I guess a confession was too much to hope for. Some story that might explain it all.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, we’ve got teams at his home and his office. We’ll know more after the search, but Esposito talked to his wife. She said he didn’t come home that night. He was working late.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m guessing he wasn’t at work.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I wonder if there were others. Or if she was the first. If her glowing presence awakened something inside him. What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s – uh … just, that crime scene.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The person that killed Tessa, he was meticulous. But when we questioned Kurtzman he got all flustered.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So if he put that much thought into killing her, then why didn’t he have an alibi prepared?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Perhaps because he was so meticulous he didn’t expect to get caught?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. What’d you find?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, they’re still processing. But so far there’s nothing in his house or his office that connects Kurtzman to the murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you check his emails?

utterance.speaker: EPSOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, there’s no mysterious deletions from his hard drive, no unusual activity. Nothing in his phone records, either.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, well that’s not a surprise. I mean, if he’s done this before he knows how to cover his tracks. What about his juvie record?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A couple of fights, stole a neighbor’s car. Nothing that explains this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then all we have is the neighbor’s ID? That’s not enough to make a case.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I think I might have found something that can help. Something Kurtzman may have missed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A diamond earring?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We found it in the couch. CSU couldn’t pull a print off it, but you see the design? That’s custom. Erica Courtney.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And you know this … how?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I recognized it. From when Jenny and I went ring shopping. Anyway, I called up the showroom. They confirmed it’s one of theirs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And do they have a record of who they sold it to?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, I ran the name and the address. They’re both fake.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What about the credit card info?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Buyer paid with cashier’s check. $12 grand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So we have no way of tracing him or the payment.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, but the store uses digital surveillance and they just sent over the tapes.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Here’s the time code for our point of sale. That’s our guy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Look at his height, build, hair color. That’s not Kurtzman. That’s – - Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s another explanation.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know. It’s somebody else. Somebody that looks like Castle.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We found his fingerprints at the crime scene. We got him on video buying jewelry for our victim. It can’t be a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Javi, what are you saying? That Castle’s a killer?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa. No, no, no. Nobody is saying that. All he’s saying is that if it were anybody else we’d look into it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We can start by looking into his financials. See if there’s any unusual activity around the time of the purchase.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fine. But we do it quietly and he never finds out about it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Javi, there’s something you need to know.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Beckett and Castle? Wha- when did they start?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m not sure. But I know they were together that weekend in the Hamptons.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why wouldn’t she tell us?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I guess she was afraid Gates would find out and use NYPD regs to give Castle the boot. I was going to keep it a secret myself, but under the circumstances …

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Normally I’d be happy for them.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Hey, you don’t really think that Castle had anything to do with this, do you?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, c’mon, man. He’s my friend, too. The best thing we can do it try to prove this evidence wrong.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, Javi.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa! Wait a minute, did I throw a party and forget again?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s not a party.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Search warrant. Gloves. Okay guys, I get it. The fingerprint thing; I’m sorry. Lesson learned. You can all go home.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s not a joke, bro.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Take him to the kitchen.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kitchen? I just –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett… Beckett, what is this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We found a piece of jewelry in Tessa’s apartment and we traced it back to the man who bought it for her. Castle, it was you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It was purchased with a cashier’s check for $12,780. Earlier that day you withdrew the same amount of money from your pocket account. As a cashier’s check.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You looked into my financials? You’re investigating me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kate, this is not me. And I didn’t buy any jewelry. I certainly didn’t use a cashier’s check.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then you need to explain it. This, the withdrawal, the fingerprint. You need to tell me what the hell’s going on.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beckett? In here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What is it? Guys, what is it? Kate.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Richard Castle, you’re under arrest for the murder of Tessa Horton. Turn around.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You have the right to remain silent. Anything you say can and will be used against you in a court of law.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The bag is part of a set that he owns.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wire and hooks are identical to the ones used to bind the victim. There was also a shirt inside that had some blood spatter on it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The lab says it’s a match to Tessa’s.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What’s he saying?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That he’s never seen any of it before in his life.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, he’s not a killer.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Then how do you explain all of this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The evidence isn’t the whole story. Castle’s taught me that.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: You know, I’m not always a fan of Mr. Castle’s, Detective. But even I’m having trouble believing he’d do something so heinous.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then what do we do?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Our jobs. Check his emails, computer files, and phone records. If he was involved with this girl there’s bound to be a record. Beckett, you talk to the family. See if anyone else has access to his place.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Don’t thank me yet, Detective. We’re going to follow the evidence no matter where it leads us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys, when you look through Castle’s phone records –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s okay. We know.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We won’t tell Gates unless we have to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know? How?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well it’s us, so …

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We didn’t say anything because we figured it was nobody’s business, but we gotta ask. Were you with him that night?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. He uh … I – I was supposed to be. His uh, mom was out of town and then he said that he needed time to write.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where’s Beckett?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Under the circumstances I think it’s best if I handle the interrogation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mon, Captain. This is insane. I didn’t do anything.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: But we still need to investigate and you know that. So let’s start with your relationship with the victim.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, I didn’t have one.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Then any idea how your fingerprints ended up at the crime scene?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, we went over that. CSU made a mistake.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: They say that they didn’t. Castle, if you knew her –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I didn’t know her.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: She was seeing someone. Someone her roommate describes as handsome and rich.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m flattered, but it wasn’t me.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER
utterance.content: Detective? His family’s here.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Oh. Where’s Richard?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course it has my fingerprints on it. It’s my bag! But I didn’t put that stuff in there.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Then who did?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about Kurtzman? We know he was at her apartment that night. And he lied about it.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Kurtzman alibied out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? When?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: An hour ago. His lawyer got him to cooperate. Turns out he was lured there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lured?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: By a text message Tessa sent. Only it wasn’t from Tessa. It was from a burner phone. When Kurtzman showed up, Tessa told him she didn’t send it so she sent him on his way.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well then, why did he lie about it?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Because he spent the rest of the evening with a paid companion. And didn’t want his wife to know.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: So. What about you, Mr. Castle? Where were you the night of the murder?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was at home writing.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: And did anyone see you there?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I was … alone.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: So, for the record, you’re saying you have no alibi.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think I’d like my lawyer now.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, this is madness. This is just madness.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s temporary. We just need out find out the truth. Now, can anyone else access your apartment? Does anyone have keys?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, Alicia, the housekeeper.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah, but she’s been with us 15 years. And there’s a security system. Even if someone had a key the alarm would go off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Have you noticed anyone out of the ordinary in the building lately? A maintenance worker, deliveryman? Anyone that could have been casing the place?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No, no, no, no. Nothing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks. I’ll be here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, whoever is behind this, whatever is going on, I will figure this out. I promise.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: In the meantime you have some visitors.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh. Oh, Richard. Oh, darling.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Tech just finished with Castle’s computer. Parts of it have been wiped, just like Tessa’s.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Were they able to re-recover anything?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: They found a file that he deleted. It was a story concept about how to commit the perfect murder.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beckett, the character gets away with it by staging a crime scene so bizarre the cops can’t see he’s hiding right under their noses.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It was like a dry run on paper. All the way down to the weird symbol we found on the victim’s forehead.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We found something else on his drive. Emails. Dozens of them. Between Castle and the victim.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Beckett. They’d been having an affair.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They started up about 8 weeks ago, according to those emails. He met her after one of his book signings and he asked her out for coffee and that was – it was just a couple of weeks after we started seeing each other.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Oh, sweetie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He told her that he needed to keep it a secret because he was with someone else. And then when he tried to break it off about a week ago, she threatened to go and tell his girlfriend. He offered to come over to her apartment to talk things through and that was the night of the murder.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: He had motive. What did Castle say when you talked to him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He said that the emails were faked. He said that he never wrote that story and that he was being framed. You should have seen him, Lanie. He looked like a little boy. He was so scared. I know him, Lanie. He is an immature, egotistical, self-centered jackass sometimes. But he’s not this.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: JERRY TYSON
utterance.content: They say dogs can smell fear. Did you know some humans can as well? You reek of it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tyson.

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: I prefer 3XK. How long has it been since I left you and Detective Ryan in that motel room?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Somebody! Help! Somebody, I need some help in here!

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: They can’t hear you. Or see you, I’m afraid. I’m much more thorough than that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You did this. You killed Tessa.

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: No, she’s not my type. I prefer blondes, remember? Here’s a much more believable story. You killed Tessa. It practically writes itself. After all, you commit murder every day in your mind for your books. It’s not hard to imagine that you’d finally cross the line.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why are you doing this, Tyson?

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: Four years, Castle. I gave up four years of my life planning the perfect vanishing act so that the cops would stop looking for me. So that I could begin again. So that I could begin killing again. So that I could taste that fear again. Four years. You ruined it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, if it’s revenge you wanted, why not just kill me?

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: Where’s the fun in that? No, no, no. It’s more fun to destroy you. Why do you think I let you live that night in the motel? People think it’s killing that I like. But murder’s just an act. It’s all about the anticipation, the planning. Watching you and your daughter take a walk. You and Beckett making love? Standing in your living room, being inside your life. Knowing that I’m going to take it all away from you. That’s what I like.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You won’t get away with this.

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: Oh, please. What are you going to do? You gonna tell them that I came here? You think that they’re gonna believe the lies of a desperate man?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett will.

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: Hm. Even if she does … … she can’t save you. There’s no time. When the DA files charges tomorrow, they’re going to send you to Central Booking. The Tombs. I have people waiting. For you. You will not last the night. And that’ll be her punishment. Believing that you were innocent and not being able to stop it. It’ll haunt her for the rest of her life. Lucky for you, you’ll be dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We went through the surveillance footage from last night. There’s no evidence that Jerry Tyson was in the station and there’s no evidence that the system had been tampered with.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, I swear to you he was here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I know. I sound crazy. A desperate story from a desperate man. Just – just like he wanted.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re right, it does sound desperate. But it’s the first time that this story has made sense.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You believe me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I never stopped.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s going to kill me, Kate. I can’t run. I can’t hide. What am I supposed to do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m telling you, it’s the Triple Killer. Strangulation, misdirects, planting evidence. It’s Tyson’s MO.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: 3XK targeted multiple victims, always women, never men. So why the change?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Revenge. That’s the only thing that explains everything.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: No, not everything. Not that video of Castle.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, actually it might.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Tyson did something similar in the Russo case. He used a double for the cameras to throw us off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, the DA has already filed charges. They’re going to send him to Central Booking today. We know that we can prove this. We just need more time.

utterance.speaker: ADA TONI GONZALEZ
utterance.content: You want the DA’s office to do what?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: All we’re asking for is a delay until we can sort this all out.

utterance.speaker: GONZALEZ
utterance.content: No, what you’re asking for is preferential treatment for a murder suspect. You want to sort this out, you sort it out after he’s arraigned.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I don’t think you understand. There’s not going to be an after.

utterance.speaker: GONZALEZ
utterance.content: If it’s his safety you’re concerned about we’re prepared to put him in protective custody.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you have any idea who you’re dealing with? Do you even know what Jerry Tyson has proven himself capable of?

utterance.speaker: GONZALEZ
utterance.content: Who do you think met with the families of his victims and held their hands when he slipped through your fingers, Detective? I’m very aware of what 3XK is capable of.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then you should know that your protective custody isn’t worth a damn. If he wants to kill Castle he’s gonna find a way to do it.

utterance.speaker: GONZALEZ
utterance.content: Captain Gates, aside from your unsubstantiated claim from a murder suspect, can you offer the DA’s office one shred of evidence of 3XK’s involvement?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Not at this time.

utterance.speaker: GONZALEZ
utterance.content: Then we’re done here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ve spent some time at Central. I’ve seen the Tombs. The way they stack bodies in those cells? If there’s a bounty on Castle’s head protective custody isn’t going to do jack.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And that’s assuming Tyson paid off a prisoner. Could be a guard.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So we can’t protect him. Not there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We have to stop that transfer. We need evidence that 3XK was involved.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but we’ve got nothing to go on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, to pull this off he needed access to Castle’s loft, so get teams over there and tear that place apart. Find me a fingerprint, a hidden microphone, a broken window jamb, anything that puts him there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Tessa was seeing someone. If it wasn’t Castle –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then maybe it was Tyson. Hit her office. Looks for files, schedules, client lists. There’s gotta be something that ties back to him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. I just heard from the team at Castle’s loft. Nothing yet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So it’s gonna happen just like Tyson said, huh? I’m not gonna be able to save him in time.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’re not done yet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jav – how secure is Holding?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Whoa. You’re not even thinking about that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re talking about his life. We can’t let them take him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Are you crazy? It would never work. You’ll never get out of hHolding.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tyson did it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Because nobody was looking for him. He had weeks to plan it – maybe even longer. You – I know how you feel about the guy. I love him, too. But there’s nothing we can do.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Beckett? They're here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is so much less fun than the other night at your place. Do you remember the first time you handcuffed me? We were at the New York Public Library. Remember how angry you were that I wouldn’t stop investigating that case?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I remember.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What I wouldn’t give to be there now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, this isn’t over. I promise you I will get you out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s okay. Whatever happens, it’s okay.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t be sorry. I don’t need sorry. I need to find this son of a b*itch and put him in the ground.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER
utterance.content: Detective Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: OFFICER
utterance.content: We’re here to transport one of yours to Central. A uh – Richard Castle?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Yes, I’m looking at the transfer order right here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, the paperwork says that the badge number was 871324.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Are you sure? Central Booking says he never arrived. They don’t know where in the hell he is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right, okay. The badge numbers on the paperwork don’t exist. They were imposters.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s gotta be Tyson.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s not going to have Castle killed, he’s going to kill him himself.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: The DA is calling it a prisoner escape. They’ve issued an APB and instructed me to begin a manhunt.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What? They think Castle did this?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well, as far as they’re concerned he’s well connected, knows our procedure, and has substantial resources.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: You two keep working the Tyson angle. I’ve got this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Resources.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Can you believe that? Branding Castle a fugitive when he’s probably being held captive by a serial killer? So what’s our next … move?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank God you’re okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank God you understood my message.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The first time that I cuffed you, what you wouldn’t give to be back there now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I knew I couldn’t call once I left.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, how did you do it? How did you escape?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I had a great lawyer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Someone owed me a favor. The less you know the better. But the good news is, I’m still alive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The DA has branded you a fugitive. Every cop in New York is looking for you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, but they won’t be the only ones after the 5 o’clock news. And by now they’ve tagged my phone, my house, my accounts. I’m not going to last long out here. We have to act quickly.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ve got teams at your place looking for any trace of Tyson. Ryan is wading through paperwork at Tessa’s office to see if there’s a connection.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well that could take weeks. I think I’ve got something better. Sitting in holding I kept thinking, how could he possibly pull this off? How could he get video of me buying those earrings? And then it hit me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Broadway Casting?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You want someone to play a role? You cast it. Look at this advertisement from 4 months ago by a celebrity lookalike firm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Private book club party.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look who they’re looking for.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: James Patterson, Stephen King, J.K Rowling –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And … me.

utterance.speaker: CASTING AGENT
utterance.content: Yeah, we placed that ad. Sent a couple of headshots over to the client’s PO Box but never heard back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … could I get the address?

utterance.speaker: CASTING AGENT
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And did you send over any Richard Castles?

utterance.speaker: CASTING AGENT
utterance.content: Let me check.

utterance.speaker: CASTING AGENT
utterance.content: Just one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Great. We’ll need his information as well.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, thanks. So the PO Box the agency sent the headshots to was paid for in cash and rented for a month. They owners gave no forwarding address. It’s a dead end.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tyson might be a dead end but Richard Castle isn’t. Look, it’s me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE LOOKALIKE
utterance.content: Yeah, people come up sometimes. Ask me to sign your books. So I figured I’d submit. But I never heard back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, now that I’m up close I really don’t see it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah …. So uh, is this you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE LOOKALIKE
utterance.content: Yeah, that was for a reality show in store security. It was an odd gig. They sent me in to buy earrings.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And was this man involved somehow?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE LOOKALIKE
utterance.content: He looks a little like the show’s producer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You wouldn’t happen to have his contact information, would you?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What do you mean he’s with you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo, not now. I need an address.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right. The address for the show’s producer is another dead PO Box and the phone number is defunct.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, what about his paycheck?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, I talked to the bank and the corporate account that cut the check is closed and the corporate contact, Joseph Vacher, doesn’t seem to exist.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, he exists all right. Or at least he used to. Joseph Vacher was a French serial killer from the late 1800s.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So he’s got a sense of humor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Have any other checks been written from that corporate account?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Cut to a Kurtzman Insurance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tessa worked for them.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So there’s no mention of Vacher in her policy files. But there was an entry in her calendar … yeah, here it is… 6 weeks ago. Site visit with a J.V.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well that’s him. Has to be.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she write anything else with it? A phone number, emails, an address?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No phone number, but there is an address. Maybe where they went for the site visit. Looks like it’s in northern Manhattan near the bridge.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, he was posing as a building owner looking for insurance. He probably found an empty property. Could be worth a look. Kev, hook up with Espo and meet us there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Someone saw the news. We gotta go.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Owner says it’s unoccupied. Says there hasn’t been a tenet for nearly a year.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then who’s up there?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Could be someone or could be just a light.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you guys see that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right guys, let’s move. C’mon.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: There’s nothing. Just a sheet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys? Over here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Once he obtained Castle’s print from his loft he used binding agents and rubber cement to build a model of his fingerprint.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Surveillance photos, architectural plans from Castle’s loft –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A precinct map, including the locations of all of our video cameras. He orchestrated everything, right down to the last detail.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He even implicated Kurtzman to make it look like Castle was covering his tracks.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I don’t get it. Why go through all this just to set you up?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because death only takes a moment. The preparation and pageantry, that’s what he loves.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well, Mr. Castle. It looks like you’re off the hook. I’ve spoken to the DA and they’ll be dropping all charges.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you, sir.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: For this, at least. There’s still the matter of your escape from custody. However, under the circumstances I’m pretty sure you can negotiate down to time served. Uh, Detective? Why don’t you take him down to the station and start the paperwork.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. So the tactical team has searched the whole building. No sign of him.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: When CSU finishes, fall back and put the building under surveillance.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if he’s already seen us and he doesn’t come back?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Every cop in this city is looking for him. He won’t get far.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Just finding that stuff of Tyson’s seems lucky.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, sometimes luck is all you need. He can’t hide now. We’ll find him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: For what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Believing in me. I mean, given my reputation, my history, when you saw those emails it would’ve been real easy not to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, things have never been easy between you and me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe that’s what makes it all worthwhile-

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s Tyson. Castle, get down!

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: C'm'ere. Castle! I got your girl!

utterance.speaker: TYSON
utterance.content: Are you watching? I want you to see this! Think that I’d let you live after everything you’ve done? Castle? C’mon! I want you to watch. I want you to watch as I take her life.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Over here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They still haven’t found the body.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They won’t. He’s not dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, what are you saying?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This was never about me. This was about him. Those initials in her datebook? He’s not that careless. He wanted us to find that place. He wanted us on this bridge. Tessa’s murder, the frame up, all of it was to get us here so we could help him do what he couldn’t do for himself. Disappear so he could start killing again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You think he planned this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How does a wanted man stop being wanted? Has to be public and has to be final.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know how crazy that sounds?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No one’s going to be looking for him anymore.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You shot him. He’s dead. It’s over.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: For now.
